Home / Communicating Progress / COP Meetings

Meetings

To find effective ways of promoting accountability and transparency of its corporate participants, the Global Compact Office has been engaging in stakeholders consultations on a regular basis. These consultations have been instrumental in defining and improving the current Communcation on Progress framework. This section contains presentations, reports and other useful information from past consultations and workshops.

First COP Workshop July 2005
Second COP Workshop March 2006
Third COP Workshop April 2007

Third COP Workshop -
Incentives and Obstacles to Communicating Progress

Palais des Nations, Geneva, 2 -3 April 2007

The Global Compact Office holds annual expert meetings on the Communication on Progress (COP), to inform about the current status of the COP process and to collect input and practical recommendations for its future work. The 2007 meeting brought together more than 30 experts from Global Compact participants, country networks, standard and service organizations, investors, academia and the Global Compact Office. Moderated by Claude Fussler, Senior Advisor to the Global Compact, the meeting focused on the following questions: How can the large number of “inactive" participants (participants that do not report) be reduced? And how can the quality of companies' COPs be further improved? The agenda, including a list of particpants, can be downloaded here.

Welcome, Introduction and the Process of Progress: What we have learned so far
Claude Fussler, Senior Advisor to the Global Compact

The State of the COP
Jeff Senne, COP Manager, Global Compact Office

Two Notable COPs

  • Ana Paula Grether M. Carvalho, Petrobras
  • Michael Hougård Pedersen, Novozymes

First Findings: The Value of Communicating Progress Project
Presentation by Stephanie Schlecht and open discussion led by Greg Unruh, The Lincoln Center for Ethics in Global Management

The Future of Reporting: Defining context and how COPs can be integrated into existing management and reporting systems.
Presentation and discussion led by Markus Nöthiger, PricewaterhouseCoopers

Incentives and Obstacles: Why some communicate

  • External Change / Engagement – Soledad Mills, CSCC
  • Responding to Investors – Lila Preston, Generation Investment Management

Incentives and Obstacles: Why others do not
Open discussion led by Flavio Fuertes, Global Compact - Argentina

Open Issues

  • To Template or not to Template? – Isabel Garro , Global Compact - Spain
  • Benchmarking? – Fritz Brugger, Guilé Engagement Team
  • Principles of Excellence in Reporting? – Alan Knight, AccountAbility
  • Peer Review - Tara Hopkins, Rio Tinto
  • Annual reporting for bi-annual reporters? – Lisa Huggins-Chan, Cadbury Schweppes
  • Headquarters and Subsidiaries; How to implement and report? – Angel Fraile, ENDESA

What can we do foster continual improvement for those who are communicating and help those who are not?
Presentation by Jeff Senne and open discussion led by Oliver Johner, COP Analyst, Global Compact Office.

  • Presentation one
  • Presentation two


Using the GRI G3 Guidelines to Communicate Progress
Discussion led by Alyson Slater, GRI

  • Presentation by Anne Gambling, Holcim
  • Presentation by Jens Rupp, Coca Cola HBC
